subject: Critical Thinking
title: Online Debates: Arguing in the Digital Arena
description: A quick, practical guide to Online Debates: Arguing in the Digital Arena.

hook.text: A Twitter thread has 500 replies. Nobody changed their mind. Everyone's more entrenched. What went wrong?

buildup.text: Online debates fail because: no tone of voice, no accountability, audience > opponent, character limits, & algorithmic.

discovery.text: Research shows that online arguments almost never change participants' minds â€“ but they DO change lurkers' minds.

twist.text: This reframes online debate: you're not arguing to convince your opponent.

climax.text: Best practices: be calm, cite sources, concede valid points, & never insult.

punchline.text: Online, you never convince your opponent. You convince everyone watching.

quiz.question: Who benefits most from well-conducted online debates?
options: Silent observers (lurkers) who are still forming their opinions
